archimate:CommunicationNetwork.name: Core Network
archimate:CommunicationNetwork.documentation:
Core Network - Local Area Network (LAN)
• Core Switches
Function: High-capacity, high-performance network backbone
Relationships:
 Connects to → Distribution Layer: At 10/40 Gbps  Connects to → Data Center Infrastructure: At 40/100 Gbps  Connects to → WAN: At 10/40 Gbps  Secured by → Firewalls: For network segmentation and security  Monitored by → IDS/IPS: For threat detection and prevention
• Router Cluster
Function: Manages traffic between network segments, provides redundancy
Relationships:
 Connects to → Core Switches: For internal routing  Connects to → Internet Gateway: For external traffic routing  Protected by → Firewalls: For security enforcement
• DC Interconnect
Function: High-speed connectivity between data centers (main and DR)
Relationships:
 Connects → Core Switches to Disaster Recovery: Ensures data replication path  Requires → Data Encryption: For secure data transfer between sites
